p: A. nodosum populations located at the northern edge of the species occurrence grew 2.4 times slower than populations located further south, i.e., along the Atlantic coasts (Fig. 6). Indeed, annual growth rate of A. nodosum tended to increase from populations at 40 oN to those growing at 55 oN, where maximum growth rates were reported (Fig. 6a). Above 60 oN, A. nodosum growth rate rapidly decreased the further north the populations were located (Fig. 6).
